title.narrative: Life-saving interventions to reduce preventable mortality and morbidity among U5 children and pregnant and lactating women

description.narrative: The project objective is to reduce preventable and avoidable mortality and morbidity through life-saving interventions among U5 children and pregnant and lactating women in 28 counties in five provinces. Support includes the delivery of Oral Rehydration Solution for treatment of diarrhoea; essential medical kits at primary health care level for treatment of prevalent diseases; and essential basic consumables and renewables.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

humanitarian-scope.narrative: KOREA, DEMOCRATIC PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF MULTIPLE EMERGENCIES 2018

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Life-saving interventions to reduce preventable mortality and morbidity among U5 children and pregnant and lactating women

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS KOREA, DEMOCRATIC PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES MULTIPLE EMERGENCIES 2018

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Delivery of Essential Medical Kits (EMKs) at primary health care level (Ri hospitals and clinics) and Household Doctor bags refill at community level in 28 counties in five provinces for treatment of prevalent diseases for under five children and PLWs.
Children under 5 and pregnant & lactating women having access to essential medical kits

Delivery of essential basic consumables and renewables (for EmONC services) to Ri level healthcare facilities in 28 UNICEF-supported counties in 5 provinces for 102,209 pregnant & lactating women and new-borns.
Pregnant women have access to Emergency obstetric care in 28 counties
